message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.MA 

This paper deals with a stochastic control problem in the context of cyber-physical systems, which involves sequential decision making with a finite set of actions. The problem involves partial observability and uncertainty about future availability of actions, which are common themes in the sub-fields of control systems (cs.SY), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also presents an algorithm to compute Whittle's index, which is a well-known technique in information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper focuses on dynamic scheduling, which is a topic in the sub-field of multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
